Description: Fragment of wall of Attic black-figured pottery closed vase. Inside reserved; outside, leg and shield of a standing hoplite facing left; red rim to shield and white blazon of running leg. Perhaps a departure scene.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Antikenmuseum, Heidelberg. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Heidelberg, Antikenmuseum I52-I77 and I85-I92 have in the past been erroneously known and cited as J52-77 and J85-92.
Bibliographic references: CVA Heidelberg IV / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Deutschland Heidelberg, Universität (p.50 pl. 165.14)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1218)
